translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Section with Timira
. The Elder Bodhisiñcaka’s Birth Story🔽“At the great enlightenment festival
of the Fortunate One Vipassī,
I went forth and became a monk,
and I approached then.
Taking a flower and water,
I sprinkled it on the Bodhi Tree;
‘He will liberate us if he is liberated,
he will cool us if he is cooled.’
For ninety-one eons
I sprinkled the Bodhi Tree;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of sprinkling the Bodhi Tree.
For thirty-three eons that have passed
there were rulers of the people;
called Udakasecanā,
eight of them were Universal Monarchs.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Bodhisiñcaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bodhisiñcako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Bodhisiñcakattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā bodhisiñcakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽bodhisiñcaka therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Bodhisiñcaka’s Birth Story is the ninth.
